LanguageData.Charged.label: charge
LanguageData.Charged.description: The charged particle coating disrupts armor and tissue in equal measure.
LanguageData.ChargedST.label: stable charge
LanguageData.ChargedST.description: Stable charged particles do not ignite objects.
LanguageData.ChargedAP.label: concentrated charge
LanguageData.ChargedAP.description: Focuses charged particles around the tip of the core for improved armor penetration at the cost of stopping power.
LanguageData.Ionized.label: ion charge
LanguageData.Ionized.description: Designed to combat mechanoids, the round creates an electrical current on impact, disrupting electronic systems temporarily.
LanguageData.IncendiaryFuel.label: incendiary
LanguageData.IncendiaryFuel.description: Filled with incendiary agent that ignites after impact.
LanguageData.NapalmFuel.label: jellied chemfuel
LanguageData.NapalmFuel.description: Highly flammable liquid, burns over time and catches nearby objects on fire.
LanguageData.JelliedPrometheumFuel.label: jellied Prometheum
LanguageData.JelliedPrometheumFuel.description: Advanced pyrophoric compound in gel-form. Self-ignites on contact with air, sticks to skin and seeps into openings, burning even mechanoids.
LanguageData.ThermobaricFuel.label: thermobaric
LanguageData.ThermobaricFuel.description: Filled with high-explosive aerosol that causes a large explosion and ignites flammable materials.
LanguageData.FoamFuel.label: foam
LanguageData.FoamFuel.description: Special round designed for civilian fire-fighting purposes. Filled with fire-retardant foam to suppress fires in a large area.
LanguageData.Smoke.label: smoke
LanguageData.Smoke.description: Special round designed for civilian fire-fighting purposes.
LanguageData.Antigrain.label: antigrain warhead
LanguageData.Antigrain.description: A tiny ultra-tech warhead usually used by spacecraft or glitterworld war machines. Powered by a grain of antimatter, it creates a huge explosion and starts fires around the target.
LanguageData.RadiationIonising.label: radioactive (ionising)
LanguageData.RadiationIonising.description: Contains ionising gamma radiation that significantly impairs consciousness, and is a carcinogen.
